subject: Re: [junit] Junit NOT failing on fail()
msgSnippet: ... ...then I apologize. I felt sure I d read an answer there before. Thanks for correcting me. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Bradley, Todd wrote:
> > > When I look at the Ant build log, I DO see the output
> > "Foobar!", but
> > > nothing about the test failure. If I uncomment the line fail("place
> > > 1"); then the Ant build will fail normally.
> >
> > I recommend you read the JUnit FAQ (search with google.com)
> > and look for the section on testing multithreaded code.
>
> There isn't a section on testing multithreaded code
> in the current JUnit FAQ. That's why, just a few short
> days ago (when answering this same question for some-
> one else), I suggested to Mike Clark that he add this
> question to the FAQ. I never heard back, so I suspect
> Mike's tuned out at the moment.

...then I apologize. I felt sure I'd read an answer there before. Thanks
for correcting me.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
